question: When and where is Maple X Tommy Hacks happening?
answer: It will be happening in December 23rd 2022 - January 79h 2023, it will be completely virtual this year. You can participate in the hackathon from the comfort of your own home or wherever you have access to a stable internet connection. We are planning an in person closing ceremony and details will be shared soon!

question: I don't have an idea/team, what should I do?
answer: No worries! Although hackathons are often a team experience, we welcome solo hackers as well! If youâ€™d like to find a team before the event, we will be hosting a team formation opportunity shortly before the start of the hackathon!

question: Do I have to know how to code beforehand?
answer: Maple X Tommy Hacks presents a valuable opportunity for learning and growth. Experienced mentors will be available for guidance throughout the event!

question: Can I attend if I live far away?
answer: Yes, you are more than welcome to attend regardless of your location! As the hackathon will be held online, you can participate from wherever you have access to a stable internet connection. We have attendees from all over the world participating in the hackathon, and we encourage students from diverse backgrounds and locations to join us.

question: What do I make?
answer: The possibilities are endless at Maple X Tommy Hacks! You can work on any idea or project that you are passionate about. This can be anything from a new app or website, to a hardware project or social impact initiative. We encourage creativity and innovation, and we want you to use this opportunity to build something that you are excited about.

question: How many hackers per team?
answer: Each team at Maple X Tommy Hacks can have up to 5 hackers. We believe that smaller teams are more agile and able to move faster, and we encourage attendees to form teams of 5 or fewer people. However, if you prefer to work on your own, you are welcome to participate as a solo hacker as well.

question: Who is eligible to particpate?
answer: Highschool students across the globe are eligible!
